title: The Vancouver Campus Squirrel Census
original_question: To study the ecological scale of Eastern Gray Squirrels on the UBC campus, volunteers placed 50 traps with peanut bait near Main Mall on a Monday morning in October. They captured 45 squirrels, and marked each on the back of the right ear with a blue non-toxic dye (lasting 14 days). The temperature was 12℃ with 80% humidity. Due to heavy rain, the second capture was delayed until Wednesday of the following week (9 days later). Volunteers set 100 traps across campus and captured 150 squirrels. They found 12 squirrels with the blue mark. Additionally, 3 unmarked squirrels appeared weak due to the rain. Historical records show an average of 500 squirrels. Estimate the current population and identify the distractors.

segments.text: They captured 45 squirrels, and marked each on the back of the right ear with a blue non-toxic dye (lasting 14 days).
segments.explanation: 这是第一阶段捕获并标记的数量，即公式中的 M。

segments.text: The temperature was 12℃ with 80% humidity.
segments.explanation: 环境温度和湿度与捕获-再捕获法的数学估算无关，属于干扰项。

segments.text: Volunteers set 100 traps across campus and captured 150 squirrels.
segments.explanation: 这是第二阶段总共捕获的数量，即公式中的 n。

segments.text: They found 12 squirrels with the blue mark.
segments.explanation: 这是在第二次捕获中发现的带有标记的数量，即公式中的 x。

segments.text: Additionally, 3 unmarked squirrels appeared weak due to the rain. Historical records show an average of 500 squirrels.
segments.explanation: 历史平均值和松鼠的健康状况不影响基于当前数据的公式计算。

traps.title: The Distractor Trap
traps.description: 学生容易尝试将温度、湿度或历史平均值代入公式。在捕获-再捕获法中，只需关注 M、n 和 x。

solution.content: From the prompt: Marked $M = 45$, Second sample $n = 150$, Recaptured with marks $x = 12$.
Use the Lincoln-Petersen Index: $\hat{N} = (M \times n) / x = (45 \times 150) / 12 = 562.5$.
solution.source_label: 外部核心知识：捕获-再捕获估算公式

solution.content: The estimated population is approximately 563 squirrels. Distractors include temperature, humidity, squirrel health, and historical averages.

title: Coffee Shop Morning Rush Experiment
original_question: A manager recorded 12 waiting times (minutes): 3.2, 4.5, 2.8, 15.0, 3.5, 4.0, 3.8, 4.1, 2.5, 3.9, 4.2, 28.5. The 15.0 was due to a machine glitch, and 28.5 was because a customer was on a call and didn't pick up their ready coffee. The manager sees the Mean > 7 minutes and decides to hire more staff. Calculate the five-number summary and determine if the manager's decision is misled by outliers.

segments.explanation: 原始数据，需要排序后才能计算分位数。

segments.text: The 15.0 was due to a machine glitch, and 28.5 was because a customer was on a call and didn't pick up their ready coffee.
segments.highlight_text: 15.0 was due to a machine glitch, and 28.5 was because a customer was on a call
segments.explanation: 这些异常大的数值是识别离群值的核心分析信息。

segments.text: The manager sees the Mean > 7 minutes and decides to hire more staff.
segments.explanation: 均值对离群值非常敏感，可能误导决策。

traps.title: Mean Sensitivity Trap
traps.description: 在存在离群值时，均值会被极端值拉高，不能代表典型水平。

solution.content: $IQR = 4.35 - 3.2 = 1.15$. Upper Fence = $6.075$. Both 15.0 and 28.5 exceed this fence.
Correct mean ≈ 6.5 minutes. The manager is misled because the average is inflated by rare events rather than typical service time.

title: Anonymous Academic Integrity Challenge
original_question: A professor suspects students used unauthorized AI tools on a midterm. To find the true proportion, he used a 'Randomized Response' technique with 800 students. Each student flipped a fair coin in private: If Heads, they answer the true question: 'Did you use AI to cheat?' If Tails, they answer an irrelevant question: 'Were you born in an even-numbered month?' The survey showed 320 'Yes' responses out of 800. Registrar data shows that 48% of students were born in even-numbered months. Estimate the proportion of AI users ($\hat{p}$).

traps.title: Social Desirability Bias
traps.description: 直接询问敏感问题（如作弊）会导致学生撒谎。随机化回答技术通过引入‘噪声’保护隐私，从而获取更真实的统计数据。

solution.source_label: 外部核心知识：全概率公式应用

solution.content: $\hat{p} = 0.16 / 0.5 = 0.32$. The estimated proportion of students who cheated is 32%.

title: Gym Challenge: Squat vs. Deadlift
original_question: Xiao Ming lifted 120kg in Squats (Mean=100kg, SD=10kg) and 145kg in Deadlifts (Mean=130kg, SD=12kg). His friend says he is better at Squats because he is 20kg above average, while only 15kg above in Deadlifts. Squat scores are right-skewed, while Deadlifts are normal. Calculate Z-scores and determine where he performed better relatively.

segments.text: and 145kg in Deadlifts (Mean=130kg, SD=12kg).

traps.title: Raw Difference Trap
traps.description: 不能直接比较绝对值差（20kg vs 15kg），因为不同项目的变异程度（标准差）不同。必须转化为无单位的 Z-score 进行公平对比。

solution.source_label: 外部核心知识：Z-score 公式
外部核心知识：Z-score 公式

title: Delivery Rider Tip Estimation
original_question: A platform estimates the average tip by interviewing 400 riders Downtown on a Friday night. Results: Mean = $5.20, SD = $2.00. There are 5000 total riders. The platform claims: 'We are 95% sure the true average tip for all Vancouver riders is between $5.00 and $5.40.' Calculate SE and identify two major errors.

segments.text: A platform estimates the average tip by interviewing 400 riders Downtown on a Friday night.
segments.explanation: 周五晚上的市中心不能代表全温哥华、全时段的骑手情况。

segments.text: Results: Mean = $5.20, SD = $2.00.
segments.explanation: 构造置信区间所需的样本核心数值。

segments.text: The platform claims: 'We are 95% sure the true average tip for all Vancouver riders is between $5.00 and $5.40.'
segments.highlight_text: We are 95% sure the true average tip for all Vancouver riders is between $5.00 and $5.40.
segments.explanation: 常见误区：把置信度当作‘这个区间包含真值的概率’。

traps.title: The Probability Misconception
traps.description: 一旦区间被算出来，总体均值要么在里面，要么不在。95% 指的是如果重复抽样，95% 的区间会包含真实均值，而不是当前这个区间有 95% 的概率包含它。

solution.source_label: 外部核心知识：均值标准误公式
外部核心知识：置信区间公式

solution.content: Error 1: Selection Bias (Downtown Friday is not representative). Error 2: Interpretation error (Confusing confidence level with probability of a specific interval).

title: Smartwatch Health Data Monitoring
original_question: A watch recorded 200 days of steps: Mean=10,500, Median=8,200, SD=4,000, $Q_1$=6,500, $Q_3$=11,000. Five days had >35,000 steps. Determine the shape, check for outliers, and evaluate if using a Z-score for future probability (step > 12,000) is appropriate.

segments.text: A watch recorded 200 days of steps: Mean=10,500, Median=8,200, SD=4,000, $Q_1$=6,500, $Q_3$=11,000.
segments.explanation: 均值大于中位数通常意味着分布是右偏的（Right-skewed）。

segments.text: A watch recorded 200 days of steps: Mean=10,500, Median=8,200, SD=4,000, $Q_1$=6,500, $Q_3$=11,000.
segments.explanation: 用于计算 IQR 并判定离群值。

segments.text: Five days had >35,000 steps.
segments.explanation: 这些极端天数用于离群值检验，是分析必需信息。

traps.title: The Normality Assumption Trap
traps.description: 在高度偏态（Skewed）的分布中，使用基于正态分布的 Z 分数来预测概率会产生巨大偏差，因为 Z 分数假设对称分布。

solution.content: Since Mean (10,500) > Median (8,200), the distribution is right-skewed.
$IQR = 11,000 - 6,500 = 4,500$. Upper Fence = $11,000 + 1.5 \times 4,500 = 17,750$. 35,000 is much greater than 17,750, so those 5 days are extreme outliers.
solution.source_label: 外部核心知识：离群值公式

solution.content: Using Z-score/Normal model is NOT appropriate because the distribution is highly skewed and contains extreme outliers. Empirically, at least 25% of data is already above 11,000 ($Q_3$).
